Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2010 10:53PM mintie wrote: I think a certain level of stress is fine but it is the continual stress wether physical or emotional that contributes, my lump was big and I discovered it in the shower, they say that if you find your own lump you have probably had it for 7 to 10 years by then my initial and traumatic loss would have been my mother in 2002 and I found it end of 2009 so that would be 7 years maybe that was when my immune broke down and it was able to continue and grow due to further stress and loss.
Posts.Title: Stress and Breast Cancer lukejessesmom texasrose361

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2010 06:50AM mintie wrote: I agree that in my case one of the strongest factors was stress , from what I have read cortisol -increases when we are stressed and if you remain stressed for a long period of time I think that it causes the weakness in our cells. My stresses came from a great deal of loss just about a year apart for each one firstly my mother to suicide, then my father to cancer, then my paster to cancer,then my 97 year old nana and her mother died at 95 so on the female side strong genes, then my sister in law to suicide and it was after about a year and a half after this loss that i descovered a large lump. I am very thankful that since finding out I had cancer I had some great delivering prayer on my mind and spirit so I am not walking around anymore with the darkeness I had as after all these losses I can say that i was starting to loose focus on those here still and had more focus on those who had passed away , and especially with two being suicides and all that comes with that. So I may have cancer but I can say I am happier in myself now since receiving the prayer I got and looking at living my life to the fullest.
Posts.Title: Stress and Breast Cancer lukejessesmom texasrose361
